recipes.title: Iron-Boosting Spinach & Lentil Stew
recipes.description: Replenishes iron lost during birth. Lentils provide plant-based protein for milk production. Easy to eat one-handed while nursing.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion until soft (3-4 min).
Add garlic, cumin, and turmeric. Stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in lentils, tomatoes, and broth. Bring to boil, then reduce heat.
Simmer 20 minutes until lentils are tender.
Stir in spinach until wilted. Season with salt, pepper, and lemon.
Serve warm. Store leftovers up to 4 days or freeze for 3 months.
tips: Add a fried egg on top for extra protein
Batch cook and freeze in portions for exhausted days
Pairs well with crusty bread or rice

recipes.title: Salmon & Sweet Potato Power Bowl
recipes.description: Omega-3 fatty acids support brain development in breastfed babies. Sweet potatoes provide sustained energy and vitamin A for recovery.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C. Toss sweet potato cubes with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and paprika.
Roast sweet potatoes for 20 minutes until tender.
Season salmon with salt and pepper. Pan-sear in remaining olive oil, 4 min per side.
Arrange arugula in bowls. Top with sweet potato, flaked salmon, and avocado.
Drizzle with tahini mixed with lemon juice. Serve immediately.
tips: Use canned salmon for a quicker version
Prep sweet potatoes ahead and refrigerate
Add quinoa for extra sustenance

recipes.title: Bone Broth Healing Soup
recipes.description: Collagen supports tissue repair after birth. Amino acids aid gut healing and reduce inflammation. Deeply nourishing and easy to digest.
instructions: Heat bone broth in a pot over medium heat.
Add sliced carrots and ginger. Simmer for 3-4 minutes until carrots soften.
Ladle into bowls. Add halved soft-boiled eggs.
Garnish with green onions and fresh herbs.
Season to taste and serve warm.
tips: Make bone broth in batches and freeze in portions
Add rice noodles for a more filling meal
Sip throughout the day for continuous nourishment

recipes.title: Lactation Cookie Energy Bites
recipes.description: Oats and brewer's yeast are galactagogues that support milk production. Perfect one-handed snack for nursing sessions.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Mix until fully combined.
If mixture is too dry, add 1 tbsp milk. If too wet, add more oats.
Roll into 20 small balls using your hands.
Place on a lined baking sheet. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Store in airtight container in fridge for up to 1 week.
tips: Substitute almond butter for peanut-free version
Add dried cranberries or coconut flakes
Keep a container by your nursing station

recipes.title: Healing Turmeric Golden Milk Oatmeal
recipes.description: Turmeric reduces postpartum inflammation. Oats provide sustained energy and support milk production. Warming and comforting for early mornings.
instructions: Combine oats, milk, turmeric, cinnamon, and black pepper in a pot.
Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, for 5-7 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl. Drizzle with maple syrup.
Top with sliced banana and walnuts.
Serve warm.
tips: Black pepper increases turmeric absorption by 2000%
Add a scoop of collagen powder for extra healing
Make overnight oats version by refrigerating uncooked mixture

recipes.title: Postpartum Recovery Chicken Congee
recipes.description: Traditional postpartum food across Asian cultures. Gentle on digestion while providing protein and hydration. Ginger warms the body and aids recovery.
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear.
Bring broth to boil with chicken thighs and ginger slices.
Add rice, reduce heat to low. Simmer 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove chicken, shred meat, and return to pot.
Ladle into bowls. Top with green onions, sesame oil, soy sauce, and white pepper.
tips: Use a slow cooker for hands-off cooking
Freeze in portions for easy reheating
Add a soft-boiled egg for extra nutrition

recipes.title: Iron-Rich Beef & Beetroot Salad
recipes.description: Beef and beetroot together maximize iron absorption. Supports blood replenishment after delivery. Fresh and energizing.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C. Toss beetroot with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt. Roast 20 minutes.
Season beef with salt and pepper. Sear in hot pan, 3 min per side for medium-rare. Rest 5 min, then slice.
Arrange greens on plates. Top with beetroot and sliced beef.
Scatter feta and walnuts over salad.
Drizzle with remaining olive oil and balsamic. Serve immediately.
tips: Use pre-cooked beetroot to save time
Substitute goat cheese for feta
Add orange segments for vitamin C to boost iron absorption

recipes.title: Nourishing Chicken & Vegetable Miso Soup
recipes.description: Miso provides probiotics for gut health and immune support. Hydrating and warming. Easy to digest during recovery.
instructions: Bring water to a simmer (not boiling) in a pot.
Add mushrooms and wakame. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add tofu and chicken. Heat through for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat. Whisk in miso paste until dissolved.
Ladle into bowls. Garnish with green onions. Serve warm.
tips: Never boil miso - it kills the probiotics
Add noodles for a more filling meal
Use any leftover protein you have on hand

recipes.title: Calcium-Boosting Sardine Toast
recipes.description: Sardines with bones provide highly absorbable calcium for bone health and milk production. Omega-3s support baby's brain development.
ingredients: 1 can sardines in olive oil (with bones)
instructions: Toast sourdough slices until golden.
Drain sardines, place on toast. Mash lightly with a fork.
Layer avocado slices on top.
Add cherry tomato halves and microgreens.
Squeeze lemon juice over. Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes.
tips: Mash the bones - they're soft and packed with calcium
Use any canned fish with bones
Add a poached egg for extra protein

recipes.title: Restorative Red Date & Goji Tea Porridge
recipes.description: Red dates and goji berries are traditional blood-building foods in Chinese postpartum care. Naturally sweet and deeply nourishing.
recipes.bonus: Iron and antioxidants from dates and goji
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear.
Bring water to boil with ginger slices and red dates.
Add rice, reduce heat. Simmer 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add goji berries in last 5 minutes of cooking.
Remove ginger. Sweeten with brown sugar or honey.
Serve warm in small bowls.
tips: Find red dates and goji at Asian grocery stores
Make a double batch - reheats beautifully
Add a splash of coconut milk for creaminess

recipes.title: Green Detox Power Smoothie
recipes.description: Packed with chlorophyll and antioxidants for gentle detoxification. Cucumber and celery provide hydration.
instructions: Add coconut water to blender first.
Add spinach, cucumber, celery, and apple chunks.
Add lemon juice, ginger, and mint.
Blend on high for 60 seconds until smooth.
Pour into glass and serve immediately.
tips: Freeze banana slices for a creamier texture
Add a scoop of spirulina for extra detox power
Best consumed in the morning on empty stomach

recipes.title: Berry Antioxidant Blast
recipes.description: Berries provide powerful antioxidants that fight inflammation and support immune health. High fiber keeps you satisfied.
instructions: Add almond milk to blender.
Add all berries and frozen banana.
Add chia seeds and almond butter.
Blend until smooth, about 45 seconds.
Pour and top with extra berries if desired.
tips: Use frozen berries for thicker consistency
Add açai powder for extra antioxidants
Prep berry bags in freezer for quick morning smoothies

recipes.title: Tropical Mango Sunshine Smoothie
recipes.description: Mango and pineapple provide vitamin C for collagen production and immune support.
instructions: Pour coconut milk into blender.
Add frozen mango, pineapple, and banana.
Add turmeric if using.
Blend until creamy smooth.
Top with shredded coconut and extra mango.
tips: Add a squeeze of lime for tanginess
Freeze in popsicle molds for healthy treats
Use light coconut milk to reduce calories

recipes.title: Chocolate Protein Power Smoothie
recipes.description: Perfect post-workout recovery with protein and carbs. Cacao provides magnesium for muscle function.
instructions: Add oat milk to blender.
Add frozen banana, cacao powder, and protein powder.
Add peanut butter and sea salt.
Blend until thick and creamy.
Top with cacao nibs.
tips: Add espresso shot for mocha version
Use frozen cauliflower for hidden veggies
Add a date for extra natural sweetness

recipes.title: Creamy Avocado Spinach Smoothie
recipes.description: Avocado provides healthy fats for brain function and satiety. Spinach adds iron without affecting taste.
instructions: Add almond milk to blender.
Add avocado, spinach, and frozen banana.
Add hemp seeds, sweetener, and vanilla.
Blend until silky smooth.
Serve immediately.
tips: Add MCT oil for extra brain fuel
Squeeze of lime prevents browning
Perfect for intermittent fasting breakfast

recipes.title: Refreshing Cucumber Mint Cooler
recipes.description: Extremely hydrating and cooling. Perfect for hot days or after exercise. Low calorie but refreshing.
instructions: Peel cucumber, chop roughly.
Add coconut water and cucumber to blender.
Add honeydew, mint, lime juice, and honey.
Add ice cubes.
Blend until smooth and frothy.
tips: Freeze cucumber chunks for thicker consistency
Add a splash of sparkling water after blending
Perfect afternoon refresher

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Banana Oat Smoothie
recipes.description: Complete breakfast in a glass with protein, healthy fats, and complex carbs.
instructions: Add milk to blender.
Add frozen banana, peanut butter, and oats.
Add honey, cinnamon, and salt.
Blend until oats are fully incorporated.
Let sit 1 minute to thicken slightly.
tips: Soak oats overnight for smoother texture
Add a scoop of protein powder
Substitute almond butter for variety

recipes.title: Immune-Boosting Citrus Ginger Smoothie
recipes.description: Citrus fruits provide massive vitamin C boost. Ginger adds anti-inflammatory and digestive benefits.
instructions: Add liquid to blender.
Add orange and grapefruit segments.
Add chopped carrot, ginger, and mango.
Add turmeric.
Blend until smooth.
tips: Add a pinch of black pepper for turmeric absorption
Use blood oranges when in season
Add raw honey for sore throat relief

recipes.title: Coffee Protein Breakfast Smoothie
recipes.description: Combines morning coffee with breakfast nutrition. Protein keeps you satisfied.
instructions: Add cold brew coffee and milk to blender.
Add frozen banana and protein powder.
Add almond butter and maple syrup.
Add ice cubes.
Blend until frothy and smooth.
tips: Prep cold brew in batches on weekends
Add cacao powder for mocha flavor
Skip sweetener if using flavored protein

recipes.title: Gut-Healing Papaya Probiotic Smoothie
recipes.description: Papaya contains papain enzyme for protein digestion. Kefir adds probiotics for gut health.
instructions: Add kefir and coconut water to blender.
Add papaya cubes and frozen banana.
Add honey and lime juice.
Blend until smooth.
Top with coconut flakes.
tips: Use dairy-free coconut kefir if needed
Add a probiotic capsule for extra gut support
Riper papaya = sweeter smoothie

recipes.title: Energy-Boosting Date & Nut Balls
recipes.description: Natural sugars from dates provide quick energy without crash. Nuts add protein and healthy fats.
instructions: Add dates to food processor, pulse until sticky paste forms.
Add nuts, coconut oil, cacao, vanilla, and salt.
Process until mixture holds together.
Roll into 12 balls using damp hands.
Roll in shredded coconut. Refrigerate 30 minutes.
tips: Freeze for firmer texture
Add espresso powder for coffee flavor
Last 2 weeks refrigerated

recipes.title: Crispy Baked Chickpea Crunchies
recipes.description: High protein and fiber snack that satisfies salty cravings. Great alternative to chips.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C. Pat chickpeas very dry with paper towels.
Toss with olive oil and all spices.
Spread in single layer on baking sheet.
Bake 35-40 minutes, shaking pan halfway, until crispy.
Season with extra salt while warm.
tips: Must be completely dry before baking for crispiness
Store in open container - sealed makes them soft
Try different seasoning combos: ranch, BBQ, cinnamon sugar

recipes.title: Greek Yogurt Bark with Berries
recipes.description: Satisfies ice cream cravings with protein-rich yogurt. Fresh berries add antioxidants.
instructions: Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix yogurt with honey and vanilla.
Spread evenly on parchment, about ½ cm thick.
Scatter berries, chocolate chips, and nuts on top. Press lightly.
Freeze 4 hours until solid. Break into pieces.
tips: Store in freezer up to 2 weeks
Try peanut butter and banana version
Let sit 2 minutes before eating for best texture

recipes.title: Veggie Sticks with White Bean Hummus
recipes.description: Crunchy vegetables satisfy snack cravings with minimal calories. White bean hummus provides protein.
ingredients: Assorted vegetables: carrots, cucumber, bell pepper, celery
instructions: Add beans, tahini, garlic, and lemon juice to food processor.
Blend until smooth, scraping sides.
Drizzle in olive oil while blending.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with cut vegetable sticks.
tips: Add roasted garlic for milder flavor
Thin with water if too thick
Stores refrigerated 5 days

recipes.title: Avocado Deviled Eggs
recipes.description: Classic deviled eggs made healthier with avocado. High protein and healthy fats.
instructions: Boil eggs 10-12 minutes. Ice bath immediately.
Peel eggs, slice in half, remove yolks to bowl.
Mash yolks with avocado, yogurt, lime juice, and garlic powder.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pipe or spoon filling into egg whites. Dust with paprika.
tips: Add sriracha for spicy version
Make filling ahead, assemble before serving
Lime juice prevents browning

recipes.title: Crunchy Apple Nachos
recipes.description: Satisfies sweet cravings with fiber-rich apples. Nut butter adds protein.
instructions: Arrange apple slices on plate. Squeeze lemon to prevent browning.
Warm almond butter slightly for drizzling consistency.
Drizzle almond butter and melted chocolate over apples.
Sprinkle with granola, coconut, and chocolate chips.
Serve immediately.
tips: Use different apple varieties for color
Try peanut butter or sunflower seed butter
Add dried cranberries or raisins

recipes.title: Zucchini Pizza Bites
recipes.description: All the pizza flavor without the carbs. Makes vegetables exciting.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C. Line baking sheet with parchment.
Arrange zucchini slices, brush with olive oil.
Bake 5 minutes to remove moisture.
Top each with sauce, cheese, and pepperoni.
Bake another 8-10 minutes until cheese melts. Add basil.
tips: Salt zucchini first and pat dry for crispier results
Try different toppings: olives, mushrooms, bell peppers
Use dairy-free cheese for vegan version

recipes.title: Chocolate Banana Ice Cream Bites
recipes.description: Satisfies ice cream and chocolate cravings. Only natural sugars from banana.
ingredients: Toppings: chopped nuts, coconut, sea salt
instructions: Line tray with parchment paper. Arrange banana slices.
Freeze banana slices for 1 hour until firm.
Melt chocolate with coconut oil.
Dip each banana slice halfway in chocolate.
Add toppings before chocolate sets. Freeze 1 more hour.
tips: Use ripe but firm bananas
Store in freezer up to 2 months
Try almond butter drizzle too

recipes.title: Cottage Cheese Protein Bowl
recipes.description: Cottage cheese is one of the highest protein snacks available. Casein protein digests slowly.
instructions: Add cottage cheese to bowl.
Top with berries and almonds.
Drizzle with honey.
Sprinkle chia seeds and cinnamon.
Eat immediately or refrigerate.
tips: Blend cottage cheese for smoother texture
Savory version: cucumber, tomato, everything bagel seasoning
High protein = great before bed

recipes.title: Seaweed Snack Rolls with Avocado
recipes.description: Seaweed provides iodine for thyroid health. Extremely low calorie with satisfying crunch.
instructions: Lay nori sheet shiny side down.
Spread thin layer of cream cheese if using.
Layer avocado, cucumber, and carrot at one end.
Roll tightly, seal edge with water.
Slice into pieces. Sprinkle sesame seeds. Serve with soy sauce.
tips: Add smoked salmon for more protein
Use cauliflower rice for sushi-style rolls
Keep nori crispy by assembling just before eating

recipes.title: Buddha Bowl with Tahini Dressing
recipes.description: Complete plant-based nutrition with protein, fiber, and healthy fats. Rainbow of vegetables provides diverse nutrients.
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package. Let cool slightly.
Roast drained chickpeas at 200°C for 20 minutes with olive oil and spices.
Make dressing: whisk tahini, lemon, garlic, and water until pourable.
Arrange quinoa, chickpeas, and all vegetables in sections in bowls.
Drizzle generously with tahini dressing.
tips: Prep components separately and assemble fresh daily
Swap chickpeas for edamame or tofu
Add kimchi or sauerkraut for probiotics

recipes.title: Teriyaki Salmon Poke Bowl
recipes.description: Fresh salmon provides omega-3s for brain and heart health. Light yet satisfying.
instructions: Cook sushi rice, season with rice vinegar.
Marinate salmon cubes in teriyaki and soy sauce for 10 minutes.
Divide rice between bowls.
Arrange salmon, edamame, avocado, and cucumber on rice.
Top with sesame seeds, pickled ginger, and nori strips.
tips: Use frozen-and-thawed salmon for safety
Add sriracha mayo for spice
Substitute cooked salmon if preferred

recipes.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Power Bowl
recipes.description: Mediterranean diet pattern supports heart health and longevity. Fresh vegetables and olive oil provide antioxidants.
instructions: Cook quinoa and let cool to room temperature.
Combine tomatoes, cucumber, olives, onion, and herbs in bowl.
Add quinoa and toss gently.
Whisk olive oil, lemon, and oregano for dressing.
Top with feta and drizzle with dressing.
tips: Add grilled chicken or lamb for more protein
Use pearl couscous for different texture
Keeps well for lunch prep

recipes.title: Korean Bibimbap Bowl
recipes.description: Traditional Korean nutrition with variety of vegetables. Fermented gochujang supports gut health.
instructions: Cook rice and keep warm.
Prepare each vegetable separately: blanch spinach and sprouts, sauté carrot and zucchini with sesame oil.
Cook beef mince with soy sauce and garlic (or press and sauté tofu).
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Arrange rice in bowls, top with vegetables in sections, add protein and egg.
Serve with gochujang and sesame seeds. Mix before eating.
tips: Use dolsot (stone bowl) for crispy rice bottom
Add kimchi for extra fermented goodness
Adjust gochujang to your spice preference

recipes.title: Southwest Chicken Burrito Bowl
recipes.description: High protein from chicken and beans. Fiber-rich for satiety. All the burrito flavors without the heavy tortilla.
instructions: Season chicken with cumin, paprika, garlic, salt. Grill or pan-fry until cooked. Slice.
Mix cooked rice with lime juice and chopped cilantro.
Warm black beans with a pinch of cumin.
Make quick guacamole: mash avocado with lime, salt, cilantro.
Assemble bowls: rice base, beans, corn, chicken, pico, guacamole, sour cream, cheese.
tips: Use rotisserie chicken for quick version
Add jalapeños for heat
Meal prep the components separately

recipes.title: Thai Peanut Noodle Bowl
recipes.description: Peanut sauce provides protein and healthy fats. Rice noodles are naturally gluten-free.
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package. Rinse with cold water.
Whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, and sriracha until smooth.
Toss noodles with peanut sauce.
Top with cabbage, carrot, and edamame.
Garnish with cilantro, crushed peanuts, and lime wedge.
tips: Add grilled chicken, shrimp, or tofu for protein boost
Use almond butter for peanut-free version
Thin sauce with warm water if too thick

recipes.title: Harvest Grain Bowl with Roasted Vegetables
recipes.description: Ancient grains provide complex carbs and fiber. Roasted fall vegetables rich in beta-carotene.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Toss squash and Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, pepper, thyme.
Roast 25-30 minutes until caramelized.
Cook farro according to package.
Whisk balsamic and maple for dressing.
Assemble: farro, roasted vegetables, cranberries, pecans, goat cheese. Drizzle dressing.
tips: Substitute quinoa or brown rice for farro
Add kale or arugula for greens
Roast extra vegetables for the week

recipes.title: Tuna Poke Bowl
recipes.description: Ahi tuna is lean protein packed with omega-3s. Light and refreshing.
instructions: Cook sushi rice, season with rice vinegar. Cool.
Marinate tuna cubes in soy sauce and sesame oil for 10 minutes.
Rehydrate wakame in cold water.
Divide rice between bowls.
Arrange tuna, avocado, mango, cucumber, and wakame on rice.
Top with sesame seeds and sliced green onion.
tips: Only use sushi-grade fish for raw preparation
Add spicy mayo for creaminess
Substitute salmon if preferred

recipes.title: Moroccan Chickpea Tagine Bowl
recipes.description: Warming spices aid digestion and circulation. Plant-based protein from chickpeas.
instructions: Sauté onion in olive oil until soft. Add garlic and all spices.
Add tomatoes, chickpeas, and apricots. Simmer 20 minutes.
Cook couscous according to package. Fluff with fork.
Serve tagine over couscous.
Garnish with cilantro and almonds.
tips: Add preserved lemons for authentic flavor
Substitute quinoa for couscous
Add harissa paste for heat

recipes.title: Acai Berry Breakfast Bowl
recipes.description: Acai berries are among the highest antioxidant foods. Natural energy boost.
ingredients: Toppings: sliced banana, fresh berries, granola, coconut flakes, chia seeds, honey
instructions: Blend acai packets, frozen banana, berries, and almond milk until thick.
Pour into bowl - should be thick enough to hold toppings.
Arrange toppings in rows or patterns.
Drizzle with honey.
Eat immediately before it melts.
tips: Freeze banana in chunks for easier blending
Use as little liquid as possible for thickness
Add protein powder to the blend for staying power

recipes.title: Herb-Crusted Baked Salmon
recipes.description: Salmon provides omega-3 fatty acids for heart and brain health.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Mix panko, chopped herbs, lemon zest, and olive oil.
Brush salmon with Dijon mustard.
Press herb mixture onto top of each fillet.
Bake 12-15 minutes until fish flakes easily.
Serve with roasted asparagus and lemon slices.
tips: Don't overcook - salmon continues cooking after removal
Use skin-on fillets for easier handling
Add parmesan to crust for extra flavor

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas
recipes.description: High protein, low carb. One pan means easy cleanup. Perfect weeknight dinner.
ingredients: Tortillas, sour cream, guacamole for serving
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C.
Toss chicken with half the oil and seasoning.
Toss peppers and onions with remaining oil and seasoning.
Spread on sheet pan in single layer.
Bake 20-25 minutes until chicken is cooked and vegetables are charred.
Squeeze lime over. Serve with warm tortillas and toppings.
tips: Don't overcrowd pan - use two if needed
Broil last 2 minutes for extra char
Works great for meal prep

recipes.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
recipes.description: Complete meal in one pepper - protein, carbs, and vegetables.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C. Cut tops off peppers, remove seeds.
Brown beef mince with onion and garlic. Drain excess fat.
Stir in rice, half the tomatoes, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Stuff peppers with mixture. Place in baking dish.
Pour remaining tomatoes around peppers. Cover with foil.
Bake 30 minutes. Uncover, add cheese, bake 10 more minutes.
tips: Use different colored peppers for visual appeal
Substitute quinoa for rice, turkey for beef
Freeze unbaked for future meals

recipes.title: Crispy Baked Chicken Tenders
recipes.description: All the crispy satisfaction without deep frying. High protein, kid-approved.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C. Line baking sheet with parchment, spray with oil.
Mix panko, parmesan, garlic powder, paprika, salt, pepper.
Set up breading station: flour, eggs, panko mixture.
Coat chicken: flour, then egg, then panko. Press coating firmly.
Arrange on baking sheet. Spray tops with cooking spray.
Bake 18-20 minutes until golden and cooked through.
tips: Spray generously for maximum crispiness
Let chicken rest 5 minutes after baking
Dipping sauces: honey mustard, BBQ, ranch

recipes.title: Mediterranean Baked Fish with Tomatoes
recipes.description: Light yet flavorful Mediterranean preparation. Heart-healthy ingredients.
ingredients: 4 white fish fillets (cod, sea bass, or halibut)
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Toss tomatoes, olives, capers, and garlic with olive oil in baking dish.
Season fish with salt, pepper, and herbs. Nestle into tomato mixture.
Drizzle more olive oil over fish.
Bake 18-20 minutes until fish flakes easily.
Garnish with fresh basil. Serve with crusty bread.
tips: Add white wine to the dish for extra flavor
Works with any firm white fish
Spoon the tomato juices over fish when serving

recipes.title: Baked Sweet Potato Black Bean Tacos
recipes.description: Sweet potatoes provide complex carbs and beta-carotene. Black beans add plant protein.
ingredients: Greek yogurt or vegan sour cream
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C. Pierce sweet potatoes with fork.
Bake sweet potatoes 40-45 minutes until soft.
Heat black beans with corn, cumin, and chili powder.
Slice sweet potatoes open, fluff insides.
Top with bean mixture, pico de gallo, avocado, yogurt.
Garnish with cilantro and lime.
tips: Microwave sweet potatoes for faster cooking
Add cheese for non-vegan version
Prep sweet potatoes ahead and reheat

recipes.title: Lemon Garlic Roasted Chicken Thighs
recipes.description: Chicken thighs are more flavorful and budget-friendly than breasts.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C.
Pat chicken thighs very dry. Season generously with salt, pepper, paprika.
Heat oven-safe pan with olive oil. Sear chicken skin-side down 5 minutes until golden.
Flip chicken. Add garlic and lemon halves cut-side down.
Transfer to oven. Roast 25-30 minutes until internal temp reaches 75°C.
Rest 5 minutes. Serve with pan juices, squeeze roasted lemon over.
tips: Dry skin = crispy skin - pat thoroughly
Let chicken come to room temperature before cooking
Save pan juices for sauce or gravy

recipes.title: Vegetable Lasagna
recipes.description: Loaded with vegetables for extra nutrition. Make-ahead friendly for busy weeks.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C. Sauté zucchini and mushrooms until soft.
Mix ricotta with egg, half the parmesan, and herbs.
Layer in 9x13 dish: sauce, pasta, ricotta, vegetables, mozzarella. Repeat.
Top with remaining sauce, mozzarella, and parmesan.
Cover with foil. Bake 40 minutes. Uncover, bake 10 more.
Rest 10 minutes before slicing.
tips: No-boil lasagna sheets save time
Can be assembled day before and refrigerated
Freezes well for up to 3 months

recipes.title: Baked Falafel with Tzatziki
recipes.description: Traditional falafel made healthier by baking. Plant protein from chickpeas.
ingredients: For tzatziki: Greek yogurt, cucumber, garlic, dill, lemon
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C. Line baking sheet.
Pulse chickpeas, onion, garlic, herbs in food processor.
Add spices and flour. Pulse to combine.
Form into 16 balls, flatten slightly. Place on baking sheet.
Spray generously with olive oil.
Bake 25 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden.
Make tzatziki: mix yogurt, grated cucumber, garlic, dill, lemon.
tips: Chickpeas must be very dry for proper texture
Chill mixture 30 minutes for easier shaping
Serve in pita with vegetables and tzatziki

recipes.title: Parmesan Crusted Baked Cod
recipes.description: Lean white fish with satisfying crispy coating. Quick enough for weeknights.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line baking sheet with parchment.
Mix parmesan, panko, melted butter, parsley, garlic powder.
Pat fish dry. Season with salt and pepper.
Place on baking sheet. Press parmesan mixture on top.
Bake 12-15 minutes until fish flakes and topping is golden.
Serve with lemon wedges.
tips: Don't flip the fish - topping stays on top
Works with any white fish
Add lemon zest to topping for extra brightness

recipes.title: Virgin Mojito
recipes.description: All the refreshing mojito flavor without alcohol. Mint aids digestion.
instructions: Add mint leaves and lime wedges to glass.
Muddle gently to release mint oils and lime juice.
Add simple syrup and stir.
Fill glass with crushed ice.
Top with sparkling water. Stir gently.
Garnish with mint sprig and lime wheel.
tips: Don't over-muddle mint - it becomes bitter
Use superfine sugar if not using simple syrup
Add cucumber slices for spa-style variation

recipes.title: Sparkling Pomegranate Spritzer
recipes.description: Pomegranate is rich in antioxidants. Elegant enough for celebrations.
instructions: Stir honey into pomegranate juice until dissolved.
Add lime juice and stir.
Fill glass with ice.
Pour pomegranate mixture over ice.
Top with sparkling water.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds and rosemary.
tips: Use champagne flute for elegant presentation
Freeze pomegranate seeds as ice cube alternatives
Add orange juice for mimosa-style variation

recipes.title: Cucumber Elderflower Cooler
recipes.description: Extremely hydrating and cooling. Elderflower adds sophisticated floral notes.
instructions: Muddle cucumber slices gently in glass.
Add elderflower cordial and lime juice.
Fill with ice cubes.
Top with sparkling water.
Garnish with cucumber ribbons and mint.
tips: Use a vegetable peeler for cucumber ribbons
Adjust elderflower to taste
Add gin for alcoholic version

recipes.title: Ginger Turmeric Tonic
recipes.description: Powerful anti-inflammatory combination. Ginger aids digestion.
instructions: Grate ginger and squeeze juice through strainer into glass.
Add turmeric, honey, lemon juice, and black pepper. Stir well.
Add ice cubes.
Top with sparkling water.
Garnish with orange slice.
tips: Black pepper increases turmeric absorption
Make ginger juice in batches and refrigerate
Add cayenne for extra kick

recipes.title: Tropical Passion Fruit Punch
recipes.description: Tropical fruits provide vitamin C. Fun, party-ready presentation.
instructions: Combine passion fruit pulp, pineapple juice, orange juice, and lime juice.
Shake with ice.
Strain into tall glass filled with ice.
Add splash of coconut water.
Top with sparkling water.
Garnish with pineapple wedge.
tips: Use frozen passion fruit pulp if fresh unavailable
Make as a batch punch for parties
Add coconut rum for alcoholic version

recipes.title: Lavender Lemonade
recipes.description: Lavender promotes relaxation and calm. Unique floral flavor.
ingredients: Fresh lavender sprigs and lemon wheels
instructions: Steep lavender in hot water for 10 minutes. Strain.
Dissolve honey in warm lavender water.
Add lemon juice and cold water. Stir well.
Refrigerate until cold.
Serve over ice with lavender sprigs and lemon wheels.
tips: Use culinary lavender only - not decorative
Adjust honey to taste
Don't over-steep lavender - it becomes bitter

recipes.title: Spiced Apple Cider Mocktail
recipes.description: Warming spices aid digestion. Perfect for fall and winter entertaining.
instructions: Combine cider, cinnamon, cloves, star anise, and orange in pot.
Heat over medium-low for 10 minutes. Don't boil.
Add maple syrup if desired.
Strain into mugs.
Garnish with cinnamon stick and apple slice.
tips: Can be made in slow cooker for parties
Add a splash of orange juice for brightness
Serve warm or chilled over ice

recipes.title: Berry Basil Smash
recipes.description: Berries provide antioxidants. Basil adds unexpected herbal complexity.
ingredients: Basil sprig and berry for garnish
instructions: Muddle berries and basil leaves in glass.
Add simple syrup and lime juice. Stir.
Fill with crushed ice.
Top with sparkling water.
Garnish with basil sprig and fresh berry.
tips: Clap basil between palms to release oils before muddling
Strain for cleaner presentation
Try strawberry-basil or raspberry-mint variations

recipes.title: Coconut Lime Refresher
recipes.description: Coconut water provides natural electrolytes. Extremely hydrating.
instructions: Shake coconut water, coconut cream, lime juice, and simple syrup with ice.
Strain into glass filled with ice.
Garnish with lime wheel and toasted coconut.
tips: Use light coconut milk for lighter version
Add rum for piña colada vibes
Freeze coconut water in cubes to prevent dilution

recipes.title: Watermelon Mint Agua Fresca
recipes.description: Watermelon is 92% water - extremely hydrating. Traditional Mexican refreshment.
instructions: Blend watermelon until smooth.
Strain through fine mesh sieve.
Stir in water, lime juice, and honey if using.
Add torn mint leaves.
Refrigerate until cold.
Serve over ice with watermelon wedge and mint.
tips: No need to strain for more rustic version
Freeze watermelon cubes as ice
Add jalapeño slice for spicy Mexican twist
